content.en: MIMO optimization: Researchers are using algorithms to address various challenges in massive MIMO (Multiple-Input Multiple-Output) systems, which are used in wireless communication. These algorithms aim to reduce the pilot overhead, improve channel estimation, and address issues like pilot contamination and unknown channel path number. By proposing innovative techniques based on compressed sensing and sparsity, these algorithms help optimize the performance of massive MIMO systems and make them more efficient.
content.da: MIMO-optimering: Forskere bruger algoritmer til at tackle forskellige udfordringer i massive MIMO (Multiple-Input Multiple-Output) systemer, som anvendes i trådløs kommunikation. Disse algoritmer har til formål at reducere pilot-overhead, forbedre kanalsestimering og løse problemer som pilotforurening og ukendt kanalvejsantal. Ved at foreslå innovative teknikker baseret på komprimeret sensing og sparsitet, hjælper disse algoritmer med at optimere ydeevnen af massive MIMO-systemer og gøre dem mere effektive.
